intro: Humata serrata, commonly known as the serrated humata, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, serrated leaves and clusters of small, white to pink flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Humata serrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some cultures for its medicinal properties.
